summary: HCSM News ~ Crisp & Delicious chicken nuggets recalled due to possible Salmonella contamination
title: HCSM News ~ Crisp & Delicious chicken nuggets recalled due to possible Salmonella contamination
body:
The Canadian Food Inspection Agency has issued a recall of Crisp & Delicious brand Chicken Breast Nuggets due to possible Salmonella contamination.



Read more from CBC https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/chicken-nugget-recall-1.4994310?cmp=rss

summary:
Tea in EARTHEN POTS?

Tradition in India.....

Bring it back globally across Railway Stations, Airports, Bus stations and in...
caption:
Tea in EARTHEN POTS?

Tradition in India…..

Bring it back globally across Railway Stations, Airports, Bus stations and in HOMES.

Most beverages are acidic. Whilst mud is alkaline and hence neutralizes the effect of the beverage to a large extent.

Aroma of EARTHEN pot only adds to the flavour of the beverage.

#earth #mothernature #acid #health #travel #travelblogger #beingsworld #home #airport
https://www.instagram.com/p/BtGYqzNhPBW/?utm_source=ig_tumblr_share&igshid=lvdacprpqzzk

summary: The One Negative Thing About Losing Weight
title: The One Negative Thing About Losing Weight
body:
Is there a down side to losing weight? What is it? #weightloss #loseweight #diet #exercise #nutrition #health #howtoloseweight #weightlosstips #weightlosstip #healthtip #healthtips #diettips#diettip

When trying to lose weight, there can be many different things that may get in your way.  Especially once you start seeing the results from losing a large amount of weight.  Many of us would automatically assume that I’m speaking of life events, jobs etc.  Honestly it’s not that at all.  Most of the time your biggest obstacles are going to come the individuals who are around you.

Losing weight…

blog.name: frasergetsfit
blog.title: Taking Back My Body
blog.description: Reading UK. 27 year old cat owner. Veterinarian. Mum. Wife. Pregnancy has seriously changed my body. Time to start taking it back. Here for body positivity, female empowerment and a good old time.

summary: My first run post pregnancy - god my body does not feel the same, I feel like I’m weighed down and all my joints are wrong..?...
body:
My first run post pregnancy - god my body does not feel the same, I feel like I’m weighed down and all my joints are wrong..? Although nothing hurt which is good.

And oh yeah I am SUPER unfit right now

blog.title: Daily Health Guide 24

summary: Running for Weight Loss: the Best Tips for Beginners
title: Running for Weight Loss: the Best Tips for Beginners
body:
Operating can construct endurance, strengthen joints, and eliminate stress. However working can also be an important exercise for weight reduction, particularly for inexperienced persons. 

“If you wish to burn numerous energy quick, working is without doubt one of the finest workouts you are able to do—particularly when completed at a excessive depth,” Stephanie Blozy, the proprietor of Fleet Ft of West Hartford, Connecticut who has a masters diploma in train science, tells Well being. “As a result of each ft are off the bottom mid­-stride once you’re working, it’s actually only a collection of jumps. The sooner you bounce and run, the extra power is required of your muscle tissues, so the extra energy burned.” 

To drop some pounds, the mathematics is straightforward: You’ll want to be sure that your calorie consumption doesn’t exceed the variety of energy you burn. Which means both consuming much less, shifting extra, or performing some mixture of each. Operating helps you create a calorie deficit that lets you shed kilos and keep your weight once you attain your purpose. It can also elevate your temper and provide you with an exciting feeling of freedom, which in flip boosts your psychological well being (hi there, runner’s excessive).

Right here’s the quantity of weight you possibly can count on to lose by working, methods to get began if weight reduction is your fundamental purpose, and the best method to maintain burning energy as you run—so that you proceed to lose kilos and aren’t tempted to throw within the towel.

RELATED: This 30-Day Plank Problem Will Remodel Your Core in four Weeks

How a lot weight you possibly can lose by working

A 140-pound particular person burns 13.2 energy per minute by working, in accordance to the American Council of Train. And the extra you weigh, the extra energy you’ll burn (it takes extra power to maneuver extra weight). This means heavier folks will expertise extra of a calorie burn on the onset once they begin working. It explains why you and a pal won’t burn the very same quantity of energy even if you happen to ran the identical distance on the identical tempo collectively.

However working for weight reduction works one other approach too: It burns a major quantity of energy after you’re completed. That’s known as extra post-exercise oxygen consumption, and analysis printed within the The Journal of Energy & Conditioning Analysis discovered that the afterburn lasts 5 minutes longer for runners than it did for walkers.

RELATED: 10 Methods to Truly Get pleasure from Operating

The best way to begin working for weight reduction

For those who’ve by no means run earlier than, you could begin sluggish and construct up your working tolerance. “Persist with a tempo during which you’d have the ability to maintain a simple dialog whereas working with a pal, and goal for 10 to 15 minutes to begin,” New York-based Grayson Wickham, a bodily therapist, licensed energy and conditioning specialist, and founding father of Motion Vault tells Well being. Pondering by way of time versus distance can even making working appear much less daunting (and fewer just like the torture of center college health club class). 

While you discover a tempo and distance that feels good, begin rising your time or distance by not more than 5% to 10% per week. “In any other case, you improve your probability of damage,” says Blozy. “That is one thing I name ‘coaching within the too's’: an excessive amount of, too quick, too quickly.” Backside line: Take heed to your physique. For those who really feel able to go additional, go for it; if you happen to’re beginning to have foot, ankle, or hip ache, otherwise you simply don’t really feel good general, you could again off a bit of.     

RELATED: three Frequent Yoga Poses You’re In all probability Doing Fallacious—Plus The best way to Repair Them                                               

The best way to sustain the load loss

Not all working is created equal, and the fitter you get, the better it’ll be to take care of the tempo you began with. The issue, although, is that your physique can have adjusted to this tempo, and also you would possibly end up within the dreaded weight reduction plateau. “The important thing to burning maximal energy when working is holding the depth excessive so that you don’t settle into a gradual state, which may occur once you run at a cushty tempo,” says Blozy.

To stop your physique from getting used to working, you could change issues up and proceed difficult your physique with longer runs, sprints, or shorter, higher-intensity runs. “Essentially the most optimum protocol to make use of for weight reduction could be incorporating dash intervals of various distances, intensities, and relaxation durations between intervals,” says Wickham. Assume: Choosing up your tempo throughout each different tune in your playlist or working a quarter-mile quick adopted by a quarter-mile at a simple job, then repeating a number of instances.

RELATED: 15 Operating Suggestions You Have to Know

Dash intervals—or hill intervals, the place you’re working up an incline repeatedly with restoration time in between—speed up your calorie burn each within the second and for the remainder of the day, says Blozy. “So even once you’re sitting at your desk, you’re burning extra energy than if you happen to didn’t train,” she explains. The extra intense the run, the extra energy your physique might want to burn after train to assist restoration.

However on the finish of the day, what’s going that can assist you essentially the most in your weight reduction targets is consistency. “All elements of health, together with working for weight reduction, depend on consistency to attain your purpose,” says Wickham. “Discover a tempo, period, depth that works for you and keep it up for the long term. That is actually the one method to create lasting change that can yield lasting outcomes.”

To get our high tales delivered to your inbox, join the Wholesome Residing publication

The post Running for Weight Loss: the Best Tips for Beginners appeared first on Daily Health Guide.

However working for weight reduction works one other approach too: It burns a major quantity of energy after you’re completed. That’s known as extra post-exercise oxygen consumption, and analysis printed within the The Journal of Energy & Conditioning Analysis discovered that the afterburn lasts 5 minutes longer for runners than it did for walkers.

RELATED: 10 Methods to Truly Get pleasure from Operating

The best way to begin working for weight reduction

For those who’ve by no means run earlier than, you could begin sluggish and construct up your working tolerance. “Persist with a tempo during which you’d have the ability to maintain a simple dialog whereas working with a pal, and goal for 10 to 15 minutes to begin,” New York-based Grayson Wickham, a bodily therapist, licensed energy and conditioning specialist, and founding father of Motion Vault tells Well being. Pondering by way of time versus distance can even making working appear much less daunting (and fewer just like the torture of center college health club class). 

While you discover a tempo and distance that feels good, begin rising your time or distance by not more than 5% to 10% per week. “In any other case, you improve your probability of damage,” says Blozy. “That is one thing I name ‘coaching within the too's’: an excessive amount of, too quick, too quickly.” Backside line: Take heed to your physique. For those who really feel able to go additional, go for it; if you happen to’re beginning to have foot, ankle, or hip ache, otherwise you simply don’t really feel good general, you could again off a bit of.     

RELATED: three Frequent Yoga Poses You’re In all probability Doing Fallacious—Plus The best way to Repair Them                                               

The best way to sustain the load loss

Not all working is created equal, and the fitter you get, the better it’ll be to take care of the tempo you began with. The issue, although, is that your physique can have adjusted to this tempo, and also you would possibly end up within the dreaded weight reduction plateau. “The important thing to burning maximal energy when working is holding the depth excessive so that you don’t settle into a gradual state, which may occur once you run at a cushty tempo,” says Blozy.

To stop your physique from getting used to working, you could change issues up and proceed difficult your physique with longer runs, sprints, or shorter, higher-intensity runs. “Essentially the most optimum protocol to make use of for weight reduction could be incorporating dash intervals of various distances, intensities, and relaxation durations between intervals,” says Wickham. Assume: Choosing up your tempo throughout each different tune in your playlist or working a quarter-mile quick adopted by a quarter-mile at a simple job, then repeating a number of instances.

RELATED: 15 Operating Suggestions You Have to Know

Dash intervals—or hill intervals, the place you’re working up an incline repeatedly with restoration time in between—speed up your calorie burn each within the second and for the remainder of the day, says Blozy. “So even once you’re sitting at your desk, you’re burning extra energy than if you happen to didn’t train,” she explains. The extra intense the run, the extra energy your physique might want to burn after train to assist restoration.

However on the finish of the day, what’s going that can assist you essentially the most in your weight reduction targets is consistency. “All elements of health, together with working for weight reduction, depend on consistency to attain your purpose,” says Wickham. “Discover a tempo, period, depth that works for you and keep it up for the long term. That is actually the one method to create lasting change that can yield lasting outcomes.”

To get our high tales delivered to your inbox, join the Wholesome Residing publication

summary: Complete Axolotl Genome Could Pave the Way Toward Human Tissue Regeneration
title: Complete Axolotl Genome Could Pave the Way Toward Human Tissue Regeneration
description: The adorable and enigmatic axolotl is capable of regenerating many different body parts, including limbs, organs, and even portions of its brain. Scientists hope that a deeper understanding of these extraordinary abilities could help make this kind of tissue regeneration possible for humans. With news today of the first complete axolotl genome, researchers can now finally get down to the business of unraveling these mysteries. via Snapzu : Health & Body

blog.name: news-queue
blog.title: #Sanders #Gabbard #Gravel
blog.description:
[Support This Blog:
*Patreon*]
I am a PROGRESSIVE (on most issues).  I am NOT a liberal.  If you are a liberal, then I wouldn't suggest following me.  There's going to come a point when we don't see eye-to-eye, debate or discussion will ensue, and in my experience, liberals can't handle the discourse.  So know your limits and be responsible for your own choices.  If you don't want to be called out on your bullshit, then don't comment on my posts.  And no one forces you to follow me or engage with me.  If what I say upsets you, then just unfollow.  You don't need to message me, pleading with me to change my views in order to keep you around.  And you don't need to pick a fight and scream about blocking me when you don't like my refusal to cater to your personal preferences.  I don't appreciate the drama liberals bring on my blog because they can't handle disagreement and rigorous debate.  IF YOU CAN'T HANDLE THE DISCOURSE, THEN DON'T ENGAGE IN IT!  
I am critical of BOTH the left wing and the right wing.  (This does not mean I think "both sides" are equal.)  If you can't handle the criticisms, then leave.  
My main sources of news are Secular Talk, The Humanist Report, The Jimmy Dore Show, The Young Turks, The Young Turks - Investigates, and The Young Turks - Politics (now known as Rebel HQ).  You can find their channels on Youtube.  I highly recommend them.
I am very mistrustful of mainstream media.  So posting an article does not mean I endorse the source, or that I agree with all aspects of the article.  If I do post an article I really disagree with (not uncommon for me to do), I try to say so (in the tags, at the very least), but sometimes I forget.  I wish I had the time to write up well thought out responses to articles, but unfortunately, that's just not possible right now.  And just FYI: not a lot of thought goes into my tag commentary.
Also, tumblr sometimes autofills tags on posts.  I don't have time to manually delete all of the autofilled-tags.  So I can't swear to their accuracy.  
All my relevant commentary is tagged with the #me tag.  I can be extremely aggressive, honest, and impatient.  So peruse with caution.  I do reblog my own commentary multiple times.  I can put a lot of work into it and I want it to actually be seen.    
Satirical posts are tagged with the #satire tag.  
Posts are scheduled throughout the day.  I do my best to schedule posts, but sometimes I make a mistake.  So if you see a post with a deadline or date that's passed, it's probably because I made a mistake when scheduling it.  
If you don't like the way I run my blog, then LEAVE.  If you don't like the way I format my posts, then LEAVE.  If you don't like the language I use, then LEAVE.  If you don't like my anger, then LEAVE. 
 Sending me messages giving me unsolicited "suggestions" about how I should run MY blog is NOT YOUR PLACE.  It is intensely rude and very presumptuous.  If you want to have discussions about issues, fine.  But tone policing and nitpicking over formatting preferences is not welcome.
I do block blogs that don't appear to be run by an actual person (this is roughly 50% to 75% of all blogs that follow me).  This includes porn blogs, blogs that are attempting to sell you something, etc.  Blocking REAL accounts is a very rare occurrence.  If I do block, these are the general guidelines. If you're responding to my posts with troll-like comments, saying the same shit over and over again, or making it difficult for me to get through my activity feed by clogging it up, then I may block you.  Disagreement is fine, but if you're engaging in death threats, inciting violence, excusing violence, being pro-violence in any way, engaging in hate speech, doxxing, etc., then I may block you.  If we're having a debate, please actually respond to my replies.  Don't be shady and try to hide my replies.  If you reblog my posts, DO NOT edit or delete anything I write.  I don't care if it's just the excerpted part of the article I include, or my own commentary.  If you want to reblog my article without the excerpt, then please just copy the link to the article and post it to your own blog.  DO NOT PLAGIARIZE ANYTHING I WRITE.  I don't care if it's my tag commentary or whatever.  If you want to use my words, all you have to do is cite me.   
 Do not advertise or promote your blogs/products/services on my posts.  Blocks may be temporary or permanent.  If I accidentally blocked you, please feel free to message me on one of my other blogs (listed below) and I can unblock you.  
Some of my other blogs: 
Mel-Esprit
Politics-Junkie
Mostly Obscure Quotes 
Mel-Colors 
Mel-Words 
My goodreads account: Here.

summary: Mexican woman jailed for miscarriage released after conviction is overturned
title: Mexican woman jailed for miscarriage released after conviction is overturned
excerpt: Dafne McPherson was accused of murdering her newborn and found guilty in July 2016, but an appeals court says evidence was flimsy.
description:
A Mexican woman who was sentenced to 16 years in jail after suffering a miscarriage in a department store bathroom has walked free after a court in the central state of Querétaro overturned her homicide conviction.

Prosecutors had accused Dafne McPherson, 29, of murdering her newborn, but an appeal court judge found that the scientific evidence used to convict her was flimsy.

The case highlights the criminalisation of women who suffer miscarriages in parts of Mexico with intensely conservative and Catholic cultures.

Mexico City decriminalised abortion a decade ago, but it remains illegal in much of the country, and women who suffer complicated births or spontaneous abortions are often targeted for prosecution.

McPherson, broke down in tears after she was released from prison on Thursday.

“I’m very happy. I’m going to be able to see my baby,” she said, referring to her daughter Lía, who she had not seen for three years.

But she had bitter words for the prosecutors. “They didn’t investigate –they didn’t do a thing … That’s why there are people inside who shouldn’t be in prison.”

McPherson was working at the Liverpool department store in the central Mexican city of San Juan del Río when she felt a sharp pain in her abdomen, and shortly after went into labour in the store bathroom.

She has always insisted that she did not even know she was pregnant, but prosecutors accused her of inducing delivery and suffocating her baby in the toilet.

Security at the store refused a Red Cross ambulance access to the parking lot, instead calling a private ambulance.

Paramedics eventually found McPherson unconscious in the bathroom, having suffered a massive loss of blood.

McPherson’s plight captured national attention after prosecutors accused her of indifference toward a newborn, describing her actions as something “not even a dog would do”.

Maricruz Ocampo, an activist on women’s issues in Querétaro argued that McPherson had been punished for not living up to an idealised vision of womanhood. “It was treated as an abortion, but it was also treated as a deficiency of her as a mother,” she said. “They said that she had to react as a ‘super woman’ because ‘that’s what every mother does’.”

McPherson’s parents were forced to sell the family home to cover legal costs.

tags: What are we mad about today?
PLEASE TAKE GOOD CARE OF YOURSELVES AND EAT PROPERLY BECAUSE I CARE ABOUT YOU
I am not a trained medical professional
Please give me sources and info if I messed something up.
summary:
Okay so let's unpack my issues with this one at a time.
1. The absurd difference between healthy maximum weights between the...
body:
OK SO HERE’S WHAT I’M MAD ABOUT TODAY

Okay so let’s unpack my issues with this one at a time.

1. The absurd difference between healthy maximum weights between the biological sexes listed. Were I a 6'3" Biological Male I would be considered perfectly healthy however since I was assigned female at birth, despite my masculine build and being also about 6'3" the current target weight set by my doctor is 190. WHY IS THERE A 23 POUND DIFFERENCE THERE? I know the argument says muscle mass and bone density but I really don’t think that’s what’s going on here, considering males don’t have breasts or wide bony pelvises to account for. (I AM AWARE THAT MEN HAVE PELVISES BUT THEY ARE NOT AS WIDE AS A BIOLOGICAL FEMALE’S)

2. In my 1st point I neglected to mention that despite being consistently, comparatively taller than 6'1" males and only about 2" shorter than my dear cis male friend who is 6'5" I am marked as 5'11" by my doctors office. Which would instead put me down to 171 pounds. Do you see the problem there? If my height is not accurately reported there is a nearly 20 pound difference in my target weight because of a 4" difference in the height that was recorded.

3. These weight differences in the chart start out seeming fair until you hit about 5'7" at which point they start to become ridiculous, leading the average observer to think “Ok so it’s probably just a few pounds difference.” That is unless they look closely.

4. This highlights the fact that inaccurate height reporting can lead to serious problems and contribute to the prevalence of eating disorders by leading patients to believe they have to be thinner or heavier than they actually need to be. A FEW INCHES CAN BE ALL THE DIFFERENCE.

Image source: https://www.bannerhealth.com/staying-well/health-and-wellness/fitness-nutrition/ideal-weight

(I am aware that this is a site for weight loss surgery, and I kind of think that makes it worse, but I do recognize that this informationmay be inaccurate or incomplete and would love to see other charts or evidence to confirm or deny my findings and inferences. I AM NOT A MEDICAL PROFESSIONAL OR A MED STUDENT SO DO NOT HESITATE TO FACT CHECK AND TELL ME IF I AM WRONG AND LEAD ME TO MORE ACCURATE INFORMATION.)

I know the argument says muscle mass and bone density but I really don’t think that’s what’s going on here, considering males don’t have breasts or wide bony pelvises to account for. 2. In my 1st point I neglected to mention that despite being consistently, comparatively taller than 6'1" males and only about 2" shorter than my dear cis male friend who is 6'5" I am marked as 5'11" by my doctors office. Which would instead put me down to 171 pounds. Do you see the problem there? If my height is not accurately reported there is a nearly 20 pound difference in my target weight because of a 4" difference in the height that was recorded.

3. These weight differences in the chart start out seeming fair until you hit about 5'7" at which point they start to become ridiculous, leading the average observer to think “Ok so it’s probably just a few pounds difference.” That is unless they look closely.

4. This highlights the fact that inaccurate height reporting can lead to serious problems and contribute to the prevalence of eating disorders by leading patients to believe they have to be thinner or heavier than they actually need to be. A FEW INCHES CAN BE ALL THE DIFFERENCE.

Image source: https://www.bannerhealth.com/staying-well/health-and-wellness/fitness-nutrition/ideal-weight

(I am aware that this is a site for weight loss surgery, and I kind of think that makes it worse, but I do recognize that this informationmay be inaccurate or incomplete and would love to see other charts or evidence to confirm or deny my findings and inferences. I AM NOT A MEDICAL PROFESSIONAL OR A MED STUDENT SO DO NOT HESITATE TO FACT CHECK AND TELL ME IF I AM WRONG AND LEAD ME TO MORE ACCURATE INFORMATION.)

trail.content_raw:
OK SO HERE’S WHAT I’M MAD ABOUT TODAY

Okay so let’s unpack my issues with this one at a time.

1. The absurd difference between healthy maximum weights between the biological sexes listed. Were I a 6'3" Biological Male I would be considered perfectly healthy however since I was assigned female at birth, despite my masculine build and being also about 6'3" the current target weight set by my doctor is 190. WHY IS THERE A 23 POUND DIFFERENCE THERE? I know the argument says muscle mass and bone density but I really don’t think that’s what’s going on here, considering males don’t have breasts or wide bony pelvises to account for. (I AM AWARE THAT MEN HAVE PELVISES BUT THEY ARE NOT AS WIDE AS A BIOLOGICAL FEMALE’S)

2. In my 1st point I neglected to mention that despite being consistently, comparatively taller than 6'1" males and only about 2" shorter than my dear cis male friend who is 6'5" I am marked as 5'11" by my doctors office. Which would instead put me down to 171 pounds. Do you see the problem there? If my height is not accurately reported there is a nearly 20 pound difference in my target weight because of a 4" difference in the height that was recorded.

3. These weight differences in the chart start out seeming fair until you hit about 5'7" at which point they start to become ridiculous, leading the average observer to think “Ok so it’s probably just a few pounds difference.” That is unless they look closely.

4. This highlights the fact that inaccurate height reporting can lead to serious problems and contribute to the prevalence of eating disorders by leading patients to believe they have to be thinner or heavier than they actually need to be. A FEW INCHES CAN BE ALL THE DIFFERENCE.

Image source: https://www.bannerhealth.com/staying-well/health-and-wellness/fitness-nutrition/ideal-weight

(I am aware that this is a site for weight loss surgery, and I kind of think that makes it worse, but I do recognize that this informationmay be inaccurate or incomplete and would love to see other charts or evidence to confirm or deny my findings and inferences. I AM NOT A MEDICAL PROFESSIONAL OR A MED STUDENT SO DO NOT HESITATE TO FACT CHECK AND TELL ME IF I AM WRONG AND LEAD ME TO MORE ACCURATE INFORMATION.)

1. The absurd difference between healthy maximum weights between the biological sexes listed. Were I a 6'3" Biological Male I would be considered perfectly healthy however since I was assigned female at birth, despite my masculine build and being also about 6'3" the current target weight set by my doctor is 190. WHY IS THERE A 23 POUND DIFFERENCE THERE? I know the argument says muscle mass and bone density but I really don’t think that’s what’s going on here, considering males don’t have breasts or wide bony pelvises to account for. (I AM AWARE THAT MEN HAVE PELVISES BUT THEY ARE NOT AS WIDE AS A BIOLOGICAL FEMALE’S)

2. In my 1st point I neglected to mention that despite being consistently, comparatively taller than 6'1" males and only about 2" shorter than my dear cis male friend who is 6'5" I am marked as 5'11" by my doctors office. Which would instead put me down to 171 pounds. Do you see the problem there? summary: Crisp & Delicious chicken nugget recall due to possible Salmonella contamination
title: Crisp & Delicious chicken nugget recall due to possible Salmonella contamination
body:
The Canadian Food Inspection Agency has issued a recall of Crisp & Delicious brand Chicken Breast Nuggets due to possible Salmonella contamination.

Read more from CTV Health News https://www.ctvnews.ca/health/crisp-delicious-chicken-nugget-recall-due-to-possible-salmonella-contamination-1.4270286
